title: Perron number
summary: In mathematics, a Perron number is an algebraic integer α which is real and exceeds 1, but such that its conjugate elements are all less than α in absolute value.  For example, the larger of the two roots of the irreducible polynomial x 2 − 3 x + 1 {\displaystyle x^{2}-3x+1} is a Perron number.
